get.description: Lists available operations for the Microsoft.BatchAI provider.

200.description: OK. The request has succeeded.

put.description: Adds a cluster. A cluster is a collection of compute nodes. Multiple jobs can be run on the same cluster.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to provide for cluster creation.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains the cluster entity.

202.description: The operation will be completed asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Update the properties of a given cluster.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains the Cluster entity.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: The operation was successful.

202.description: The operation will be completed asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about the specified Cluster.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains information about the cluster.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Get the IP address, port of all the compute nodes in the cluster.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains the list of IP addresses.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about the Clusters associated with the subscription.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains a list of Cluster entities associated with the subscription.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about the Clusters associated within the specified resource group.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains a list of Cluster entities associated with the resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Adds a Job that gets executed on a cluster.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to provide for job creation.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains the job entity.

202.description: The operation will be completed asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the specified Batch AI job.

200.description: The operation was successful.

202.description: The operation will be completed asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about the specified Batch AI job.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains the Batch AI job entity.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Gets the IP address and port information of all the compute nodes which are used for job execution.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains compute node remote login information.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: The operation was successful.

202.description: The operation will be completed asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about the jobs associated with the subscription.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains a list of Batch AI job entities associated with the subscription.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about the Batch AI jobs associated within the specified resource group.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains a list of Job entities associated with the resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: List all files inside the given output directory (Only if the output directory is on Azure File Share or Azure Storage container).

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains the list of job files.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to provide for file server creation.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains the file server entity.

202.description: The operation will be completed asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: The operation was successful.

202.description: The operation will be completed asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about the specified Cluster.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains information about the FileServer.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: To list all the file servers available under the given subscription (and across all resource groups within that subscription)

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains a formatted list of clusters and their properties.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets a formatted list of file servers and their properties associated within the specified resource group.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains a list of formatted file servers and their properties associated with the resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

vmSize.title: The size of the virtual machine of the file server.
vmSize.description: For information about available VM sizes for fileservers from the Virtual Machines Marketplace, see Sizes for Virtual Machines (Linux).

sshConfiguration.title: SSH settings for the file server.

dataDisks.title: Settings for the data disk which would be created for the file server.

subnet.title: Specifies the identifier of the subnet.

FileServerBaseProperties.description: The properties of a file server.

FileServerListResult.description: Values returned by the List operation.

diskSizeInGB.title: Initial disk size in GB for blank data disks, and the new desired size for resizing existing data disks.

cachingType.title: None, ReadOnly, ReadWrite. Default value is None. This property is not patchable.

diskCount.title: Number of data disks to be attached to the VM. RAID level 0 will be applied in the case of multiple disks.

storageAccountType.title: Specifies the type of storage account to be used on the disk. Possible values are: Standard_LRS or Premium_LRS.

DataDisks.description: Settings for the data disk which would be created for the File Server.

sourceVault.title: Fully qualified resource Id for the Key Vault.

secretUrl.title: The URL referencing a secret in a Key Vault.

KeyVaultSecretReference.description: Describes a reference to Key Vault Secret.

sourceVault.title: Fully qualified resource Id for the Key Vault.

keyUrl.title: The URL referencing a key in a Key Vault.

KeyVaultKeyReference.description: Describes a reference to Key Vault Key.

mountPoint.title: Path where the NFS is mounted on the Server.

fileServerPublicIP.title: Public IP of the File Server VM.

fileServerInternalIP.title: Internal subnet IP which can be used to access the file Server from within the subnet.

fileServerType.title: Type of the fileserver e.g. nfs, glusterfs etc.

publicIPsToAllow.title: List of source IP ranges to allow SSH connection to VM.
publicIPsToAllow.description: Default value is '*' can be used to match all source IPs. Maximum number of publicIPs that can be specified are 400.

userAccountSettings.title: Settings for user account of VMs.

SshConfiguration.description: SSH configuration settings for the VM

location.description: The region in which to create the File Server.

tags.description: The user specified tags associated with the File Server.

properties.description: The properties of the File Server.

FileServerCreateParameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Create operation.

vmSize.title: The size of the virtual machine of the File Server.
vmSize.description: For information about available VM sizes for File Server from the Virtual Machines Marketplace, see Sizes for Virtual Machines (Linux).

sshConfiguration.title: SSH settings for the File Server.

dataDisks.title: Settings for the data disk which would be created for the File Server.

subnet.title: Specifies the identifier of the subnet.

provisioningStateTransitionTime.title: Time when the status was changed.

creationTime.title: Time when the FileServer was created.

provisioningState.title: Specifies the provisioning state of the File Server.
provisioningState.description: Possible values: creating - The File Server is getting created. updating - The File Server creation has been accepted and it is getting updated. deleting - The user has requested that the File Server be deleted, and it is in the process of being deleted. failed - The File Server creation has failed with the specified errorCode. Details about the error code are specified in the message field. succeeded - The File Server creation has succeeded.

properties.description: The properties associated with the File Server.

FileServer.description: Contains information about the File Server.

vmSize.title: The size of the virtual machines in the cluster.
vmSize.description: All virtual machines in a cluster are the same size. For information about available VM sizes for clusters using images from the Virtual Machines Marketplace (see Sizes for Virtual Machines (Linux) or Sizes for Virtual Machines (Windows). Batch AI service supports all Azure VM sizes except STANDARD_A0 and those with premium storage (STANDARD_GS, STANDARD_DS, and STANDARD_DSV2 series).

virtualMachineConfiguration.title: Settings for OS image and mounted data volumes.

nodeSetup.title: Setup to be done on all compute nodes in the cluster.

userAccountSettings.title: Settings for user account that will be created on all compute nodes of the cluster.

subnet.title: Specifies the identifier of the subnet.

ClusterUpdateProperties.description: The properties of a Cluster that need to be updated.

DeallocationOption.title: Specifies when compute nodes may be removed from the cluster, if the cluster size is decreasing.
DeallocationOption.description: Possible values are: requeue - Terminate running jobs and requeue them. The jobs will run again. Remove compute nodes as soon as jobs have been terminated. terminate - Terminate running jobs. The jobs will not run again. Remove compute nodes as soon as jobs have been terminated. jobcompletion - Allow currently running jobs to complete. Schedule no new jobs while waiting. Remove compute nodes when all jobs have completed. The default value is requeue.

manual.title: The scale for the cluster by manual settings

autoScale.title: The scale for the cluster by autoscale settings

ScaleSettings.description: At least one of manual or autoScale settings must be specified. Only one of manual or autoScale settings can be specified. If autoScale settings are specified, the system automatically scales the cluster up and down (within the supplied limits) based on the pending jobs on the cluster.

minimumNodeCount.title: Specifies the minimum number of compute nodes the cluster can have.

maximumNodeCount.title: Specifies the maximum number of compute nodes the cluster can have.

initialNodeCount.title: Specifies the number of compute nodes to allocate on cluster creation. Note that this value is used only during cluster creation.

AutoScaleSettings.description: The system automatically scales the cluster up and down (within minimumNodeCount and maximumNodeCount) based on the pending and running jobs on the cluster.

targetNodeCount.title: The desired number of compute nodes in the Cluster.
targetNodeCount.description: Default is 0. If autoScaleSettings are not specified, then the Cluster starts with this target.

nodeDeallocationOption.title: Determines what to do with the job(s) running on compute node if the Cluster size is decreasing.

ManualScaleSettings.description: Manual scale settings for the cluster.

idleNodeCount.title: Number of compute nodes in idle state.

runningNodeCount.title: Number of compute nodes which are running jobs.

preparingNodeCount.title: Number of compute nodes which are being prepared.

unusableNodeCount.title: Number of compute nodes which are unusable.

leavingNodeCount.title: Number of compute nodes which are leaving the cluster.

NodeStateCounts.description: Counts of various compute node states on the cluster.

adminUserName.title: Specifies the name of the administrator account.

adminUserSshPublicKey.title: SSH public keys used to authenticate with linux based VMs. This does not get returned in a GET response body.

adminUserPassword.title: Admin user Password (linux only). This does not get returned in a GET response body.

UserAccountSettings.description: Settings for user account that gets created on each on the nodes of a cluster.

setupTask.title: Specifies a setup task which can be used to customize the compute nodes of the cluster. The NodeSetup task runs every time a VM is rebooted. For that reason the task code needs to be idempotent. Generally it is used to either download static data that is required for all jobs that run on the cluster VMs or to download/install software.

mountVolumes.title: Information on shared volumes to be used by jobs.

NodeSetup.description: Use this to prepare the VM. NOTE: The volumes specified in mountVolumes are mounted first and then the setupTask is run. Therefore the setup task can use local mountPaths in its execution.

commandLine.title: Command Line to start Setup process.

runElevated.title: Specifies whether to run the setup task in elevated mode. The default value is false.

stdOutErrPathPrefix.description: The path where the Batch AI service will upload the stdout and stderror of setup task.

SetupTask.description: Specifies a setup task which can be used to customize the compute nodes of the cluster.

location.description: The region in which to create the cluster.

tags.description: The user specified tags associated with the Cluster.

ClusterCreateParameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Create operation.

tags.description: The user specified tags associated with the Cluster.

ClusterUpdateParameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Update operation.

vmSize.title: The size of the virtual machines in the cluster.
vmSize.description: All virtual machines in a cluster are the same size. For information about available VM sizes for clusters using images from the Virtual Machines Marketplace (see Sizes for Virtual Machines (Linux) or Sizes for Virtual Machines (Windows). Batch AI service supports all Azure VM sizes except STANDARD_A0 and those with premium storage (STANDARD_GS, STANDARD_DS, and STANDARD_DSV2 series).

vmPriority.title: dedicated or lowpriority.
vmPriority.description: The default value is dedicated. The node can get preempted while the task is running if lowpriority is chosen. This is best suited if the workload is checkpointing and can be restarted.

virtualMachineConfiguration.title: Settings for OS image and mounted data volumes.

nodeSetup.title: Setup to be done on all compute nodes in the Cluster.

userAccountSettings.title: Settings for user account of compute nodes.

subnet.title: Specifies the identifier of the subnet.

creationTime.title: The creation time of the cluster.

provisioningState.title: Specifies the provisioning state of the cluster.
provisioningState.description: Possible value are: creating - Specifies that the cluster is being created. succeeded - Specifies that the cluster has been created successfully. failed - Specifies that the cluster creation has failed. deleting - Specifies that the cluster is being deleted.

provisioningStateTransitionTime.title: The provisioning state transition time of the cluster.

allocationState.title: Indicates whether the cluster is resizing.
allocationState.description: Possible values are: steady and resizing. steady state indicates that the cluster is not resizing. There are no changes to the number of compute nodes in the cluster in progress. A cluster enters this state when it is created and when no operations are being performed on the cluster to change the number of compute nodes. resizing state indicates that the cluster is resizing; that is, compute nodes are being added to or removed from the cluster.

allocationStateTransitionTime.title: The time at which the cluster entered its current allocation state.

errors.title: Contains details of various errors on the cluster including resize and node setup task
errors.description: This element contains all the errors encountered by various compute nodes during node setup.

currentNodeCount.title: The number of compute nodes currently assigned to the cluster.

nodeStateCounts.title: Counts of various node states on the cluster.

properties.description: The properties associated with the Cluster.

ClusterListResult.description: Values returned by the List Clusters operation.

experimentName.description: Describe the experiment information of the job

priority.title: Priority associated with the job.
priority.description: Priority associated with the job. Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority. The default value is 0.

cluster.title: Specifies the Id of the cluster on which this job will run.

nodeCount.title: Number of compute nodes to run the job on.
nodeCount.description: The job will be gang scheduled on that many compute nodes

containerSettings.title: If provided the job will run in the specified container.
containerSettings.description: If the container was downloaded as part of cluster setup then the same container image will be used. If not provided, the job will run on the VM.

cntkSettings.title: Specifies the settings for CNTK (aka Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit) job.

tensorFlowSettings.title: Specifies the settings for Tensor Flow job.

caffeSettings.title: Specifies the settings for Caffe job.

caffe2Settings.title: Specifies the settings for Caffe2 job.

chainerSettings.title: Specifies the settings for Chainer job.

customToolkitSettings.title: Specifies the settings for custom tool kit job.

jobPreparation.title: Specifies the command line to be executed before tool kit is launched.
jobPreparation.description: The specified actions will run on all the nodes that are part of the job

stdOutErrPathPrefix.description: The path where the Batch AI service will upload stdout and stderror of the job.

inputDirectories.title: Specifies the list of input directories for the Job.

outputDirectories.title: Specifies the list of output directories where the models will be created. .

environmentVariables.title: Additional environment variables to set on the job.
environmentVariables.description: Batch AI service sets the following environment variables for all jobs: AZ_BATCHAI_INPUT_id, AZ_BATCHAI_OUTPUT_id, AZ_BATCHAI_NUM_GPUS_PER_NODE. For distributed TensorFlow jobs, following additional environment variables are set by the Batch AI Service: AZ_BATCHAI_PS_HOSTS, AZ_BATCHAI_WORKER_HOSTS

maxWallClockTime.title: Max time the job can run.

JobBaseProperties.description: The properties of a Batch AI job.

location.description: The region in which to create the job.

tags.description: The user specified tags associated with the job.

JobCreateParameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Create operation.

experimentName.description: Describe the experiment information of the job

priority.title: Priority associated with the job.
priority.description: Priority associated with the job. Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority. The default value is 0.

cluster.title: Specifies the Id of the cluster on which this job will run.

nodeCount.title: Number of compute nodes to run the job on.
nodeCount.description: The job will be gang scheduled on that many compute nodes

containerSettings.title: If provided the job will run in the specified container.
containerSettings.description: If the container was downloaded as part of cluster setup then the same container image will be used. If not provided, the job will run on the VM.

toolType.title: The toolkit type of this job.
toolType.description: Possible values are: cntk, tensorflow, caffe, caffe2, chainer, custom.

cntkSettings.title: Specifies the settings for CNTK (aka Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit) job.

tensorFlowSettings.title: Specifies the settings for Tensor Flow job.

caffeSettings.title: Specifies the settings for Caffe job.

chainerSettings.title: Specifies the settings for Chainer job.

customToolkitSettings.title: Specifies the settings for custom tool kit job.

jobPreparation.title: Specifies the actions to be performed before tool kit is launched.
jobPreparation.description: The specified actions will run on all the nodes that are part of the job

stdOutErrPathPrefix.description: The path where the Batch AI service will upload stdout and stderror of the job.

inputDirectories.title: Specifies the list of input directories for the Job.

outputDirectories.title: Specifies the list of output directories where the models will be created. .

environmentVariables.title: Additional environment variables to be passed to the job.
environmentVariables.description: Batch AI services sets the following environment variables for all jobs: AZ_BATCHAI_INPUT_id, AZ_BATCHAI_OUTPUT_id, AZ_BATCHAI_NUM_GPUS_PER_NODE, For distributed TensorFlow jobs, following additional environment variables are set by the Batch AI Service: AZ_BATCHAI_PS_HOSTS, AZ_BATCHAI_WORKER_HOSTS.

maxWallClockTime.title: Max time the job can run.

creationTime.title: The job creation time.
creationTime.description: The creation time of the job.

provisioningState.description: The provisioned state of the Batch AI job

provisioningStateTransitionTime.title: The time at which the job entered its current provisioning state.
provisioningStateTransitionTime.description: The time at which the job entered its current provisioning state.

executionState.title: The current state of the job.
executionState.description: The current state of the job. Possible values are: queued - The job is queued and able to run. A job enters this state when it is created, or when it is awaiting a retry after a failed run. running - The job is running on a compute cluster. This includes job-level preparation such as downloading resource files or set up container specified on the job - it does not necessarily mean that the job command line has started executing. terminating - The job is terminated by the user, the terminate operation is in progress. succeeded - The job has completed running successfully and exited with exit code 0. failed - The job has finished unsuccessfully (failed with a non-zero exit code) and has exhausted its retry limit. A job is also marked as failed if an error occurred launching the job.

executionStateTransitionTime.title: The time at which the job entered its current execution state.
executionStateTransitionTime.description: The time at which the job entered its current execution state.

startTime.title: The time at which the job started running.
startTime.description: 'Running' corresponds to the running state. If the job has been restarted or retried, this is the most recent time at which the job started running. This property is present only for job that are in the running or completed state.

endTime.title: The time at which the job completed.
endTime.description: This property is only returned if the job is in completed state.

exitCode.title: The exit code of the job.
exitCode.description: This property is only returned if the job is in completed state.

errors.title: Contains details of various errors encountered by the service during job execution

executionInfo.description: Contains information about the execution of a job in the Azure Batch service.

properties.description: The properties associated with the job.

JobListResult.description: Values returned by the List operation.

RemoteLoginInformation.description: Contains remote login details to SSH/RDP to a compute node in cluster.

value.description: The collection of returned remote login details.

RemoteLoginInformationListResult.description: Values returned by the List operation.

lastModified.title: The time at which the file was last modified.
lastModified.description: The time at which the file was last modified.

downloadUrl.title: file download url, example: https://mystg.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myModel_1.dnn
downloadUrl.description: This will be returned only if the model has been archived. During job run, this won't be returned and customers can use SSH tunneling to download. Users can use Get Remote Login Information API to get the IP address and port information of all the compute nodes running the job.

properties.description: The properties associated with the file.

value.description: The collection of returned job files.

FileListResult.description: Values returned by the List operation.

ResourceId.description: Represents a resource ID. For example, for a subnet, it is the resource URL for the subnet.

Resource.description: A definition of an Azure resource.

ToolType.description: The toolkit type of this job.

name.title: The name in the name-value pair.

value.title: The value in the name-value pair.

name.title: The name of the environment variable.

value.title: The value of the environment variable.

EnvironmentSetting.description: A collection of environment variables to set.

hostPath.title: The path on the host that is to be mounted as a directory in the container.

localPath.title: The container local path where the host directory is mounted.

LocalDataVolume.description: Represents mapping of host directories to directories in the container.

image.title: The name of the image in image repository.

credentials.title: Information to access the private Docker repository.

ImageSourceRegistry.description: Details of the container image such as name, URL and credentials.

password.title: Password to login.
password.description: One of password or passwordSecretReference must be specified.

passwordSecretReference.title: Specifies the location of the password, which is a Key Vault Secret.
passwordSecretReference.description: Users can store their secrets in Azure KeyVault and pass it to the Batch AI Service to integrate with KeyVault. One of password or passwordSecretReference must be specified.

PrivateRegistryCredentials.description: Credentials to access a container image in a private repository.

imageSourceRegistry.title: Registry to download the container from.

ContainerSettings.description: Settings for the container to be downloaded.

id.title: The id for the input directory.
id.description: It will be available for the job as an environment variable under AZ_BATCHAI_INPUT_id. The service will also provide the following  environment variable: AZ_BATCHAI_PREV_OUTPUT_Name. The value of the variable will be populated if the job is being retried after a previous failure, otherwise it will be set to nothing.

path.title: The path to the input directory.

id.title: The name for the output directory.
id.description: It will be available for the job as an environment variable under AZ_BATCHAI_OUTPUT_id.

pathPrefix.title: The prefix path where the output directory will be created.
pathPrefix.description: NOTE: This is an absolute path to prefix. E.g. $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT/MyNFS/MyLogs.

pathSuffix.title: The suffix path where the output directory will be created.
pathSuffix.description: The suffix path where the output directory will be created.

type.title: An enumeration, which specifies the type of job output directory.
type.description: Default value is Custom. The possible values are Model, Logs, Summary, and Custom. Users can use multiple enums for a single directory. Eg. outPutType='Model,Logs, Summary'

createNew.title: True to create new directory.
createNew.description: Default is true. If false, then the directory is not created and can be any directory path that the user specifies.

accountKey.title: Storage account key.
accountKey.description: One of accountKey or accountKeySecretReference must be specified.

accountKeySecretReference.title: Specifies the location of the storage account key, which is a Key Vault Secret.
accountKeySecretReference.description: Users can store their secrets in Azure KeyVault and pass it to the Batch AI Service to integrate with KeyVault. One of accountKey or accountKeySecretReference must be specified.

AzureStorageCredentialsInfo.description: Credentials to access Azure File Share.

azureFileUrl.title: URL to access the Azure File.

credentials.title: Information of the Azure File credentials.

relativeMountPath.title: Specifies the relative path on the compute node where the Azure file share will be mounted.
relativeMountPath.description: Note that all file shares will be mounted under $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT location.

fileMode.title: Specifies the file mode.
fileMode.description: Default value is 0777. Valid only if OS is linux.

directoryMode.title: Specifies the directory Mode.
directoryMode.description: Default value is 0777. Valid only if OS is linux.

AzureFileShareReference.description: Details of the Azure File Share to mount on the cluster.

accountName.title: Name of the Azure Blob Storage account.

containerName.title: Name of the Azure Blob Storage container to mount on the cluster.

credentials.title: Information of the Azure Blob Storage account credentials.

relativeMountPath.title: Specifies the relative path on the compute node where the Azure Blob file system will be mounted.
relativeMountPath.description: Note that all blob file systems will be mounted under $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT location.

mountOptions.title: Specifies the various mount options that can be used to configure Blob file system.

AzureBlobFileSystemReference.description: Provides required information, for the service to be able to mount Azure Blob Storage container on the cluster nodes.

fileServer.title: Reference to the file server resource.

sourceDirectory.title: Specifies the source directory in File Server that needs to be mounted.
sourceDirectory.description: If this property is not specified, the entire File Server will be mounted.

relativeMountPath.title: Specifies the relative path on the compute node where the File Server will be mounted.
relativeMountPath.description: Note that all file shares will be mounted under $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT location.

mountOptions.title: Specifies the mount options for File Server.

FileServerReference.description: Provides required information, for the service to be able to mount Azure FileShare on the cluster nodes.

mountCommand.title: Command used to mount the unmanaged file system.

relativeMountPath.title: Specifies the relative path on the compute cluster node where the file system will be mounted.
relativeMountPath.description: Note that all file shares will be mounted under $AZ_BATCHAI_MOUNT_ROOT location.

UnmanagedFileSystemReference.description: Details of the file system to mount on the compute cluster nodes.

azureFileShares.title: Azure File Share setup configuration.
azureFileShares.description: References to Azure File Shares that are to be mounted to the cluster nodes.

azureBlobFileSystems.title: Azure Blob FileSystem setup configuration.
azureBlobFileSystems.description: References to Azure Blob FUSE that are to be mounted to the cluster nodes.

fileServers.title: References to a list of file servers that are mounted to the cluster node.

unmanagedFileSystems.title: References to a list of file servers that are mounted to the cluster node.

MountVolumes.description: Details of volumes to mount on the cluster.

languageType.title: Specifies the language type to use for launching CNTK (aka Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit) job.

configFilePath.title: Specifies the path of the config file.
configFilePath.description: This property can be specified only if the languageType is 'BrainScript'.

pythonScriptFilePath.title: The path and file name of the python script to execute the job.
pythonScriptFilePath.description: This property can be specified only if the languageType is 'Python'.

pythonInterpreterPath.title: The path to python interpreter.
pythonInterpreterPath.description: This property can be specified only if the languageType is 'Python'.

commandLineArgs.title: Command line arguments that needs to be passed to the python script or CNTK.exe.

processCount.title: Number of processes parameter that is passed to MPI runtime.
processCount.description: The default value for this property is equal to nodeCount property

CNTKsettings.description: Specifies the settings for CNTK (aka Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit) job.

configFilePath.title: Specifies the path of the config file.
configFilePath.description: This property cannot be specified if pythonScriptFilePath is specified.

pythonScriptFilePath.title: The path and file name of the python script to execute the job.
pythonScriptFilePath.description: This property cannot be specified if configFilePath is specified.

pythonInterpreterPath.title: The path to python interpreter.
pythonInterpreterPath.description: This property can be specified only if the pythonScriptFilePath is specified.

commandLineArgs.title: Command line arguments that needs to be passed to the Caffe job.

processCount.title: Number of processes parameter that is passed to MPI runtime.
processCount.description: The default value for this property is equal to nodeCount property

CaffeSettings.description: Specifies the settings for Caffe job.

pythonScriptFilePath.title: The path and file name of the python script to execute the job.

commandLineArgs.title: Command line arguments that needs to be passed to the python script

Caffe2Settings.description: Specifies the settings for Caffe2 job.

pythonScriptFilePath.title: The path and file name of the python script to execute the job.

commandLineArgs.title: Command line arguments that needs to be passed to the python script

processCount.title: Number of processes parameter that is passed to MPI runtime.
processCount.description: The default value for this property is equal to nodeCount property

ChainerSettings.description: Specifies the settings for Chainer job.

commandLine.title: The command line to execute the custom toolkit Job.

CustomToolkitSettings.description: Specifies the settings for a custom tool kit job.

commandLine.title: The command line to execute.
commandLine.description: If containerSettings is specified on the job, this commandLine will be executed in the same container as job. Otherwise it will be executed on the node.

JobPreparation.description: Specifies the settings for job preparation.

pythonScriptFilePath.title: The path and file name of the python script to execute the job.

masterCommandLineArgs.title: Specifies the command line arguments for the master task.

workerCommandLineArgs.title: Specifies the command line arguments for the worker task.
workerCommandLineArgs.description: This property is optional for single machine training.

parameterServerCommandLineArgs.title: Specifies the command line arguments for the parameter server task.
parameterServerCommandLineArgs.description: This property is optional for single machine training.

workerCount.title: The number of worker tasks.
workerCount.description: If specified, the value must be less than or equal to (nodeCount * numberOfGPUs per VM). If not specified, the default value is equal to nodeCount. This property can be specified only for distributed TensorFlow training

parameterServerCount.title: The number of parameter server tasks.
parameterServerCount.description: If specified, the value must be less than or equal to nodeCount. If not specified, the default value is equal to 1 for distributed TensorFlow training (This property is not applicable for single machine training). This property can be specified only for distributed TensorFlow training.

TensorFlowSettings.description: Specifies the settings for TensorFlow job.

error.description: An error response from the Batch AI service.

CloudError.description: An error response from the Batch AI service.

code.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

target.description: The target of the particular error. For example, the name of the property in error.

details.description: A list of additional details about the error.

CloudErrorBody.description: An error response from the Batch AI service.

code.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

details.description: A list of additional details about the error.

BatchAIError.description: An error response from the Batch AI service.

Operation.title: A REST API operation
Operation.description: Details of a REST API operation

display.description: The object that describes the operation.

provider.title: Friendly name of the resource provider.

operation.title: The operation type.
operation.description: For example: read, write, delete, or listKeys/action

resource.title: The resource type on which the operation is performed.

description.title: The friendly name of the operation

origin.title: The intended executor of the operation.

OperationListResult.title: Result of the request to list REST API operations. It contains a list of operations and a URL nextLink to get the next set of results.
OperationListResult.description: Contains the list of all operations supported by BatchAI resource provider

value.title: The list of operations supported by the resource provider.

nextLink.title: The URL to get the next set of operation list results if there are any.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The subscriptionID for the Azure user.

ResourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
ResourceGroupNameParameter.description: Name of the resource group to which the resource belongs.

ClusterNameParameter.name: clusterName
ClusterNameParameter.description: The name of the cluster within the specified resource group. Cluster names can only contain a combination of alphanumeric characters along with dash (-) and underscore (_). The name must be from 1 through 64 characters long.

JobNameParameter.name: jobName
JobNameParameter.description: The name of the job within the specified resource group. Job names can only contain a combination of alphanumeric characters along with dash (-) and underscore (_). The name must be from 1 through 64 characters long.

FileServerNameParameter.name: fileServerName
FileServerNameParameter.description: The name of the file server within the specified resource group. File server names can only contain a combination of alphanumeric characters along with dash (-) and underscore (_). The name must be from 1 through 64 characters long.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: Specifies the version of API used for this request.

SelectParameter.name: $select
SelectParameter.description: An OData $select clause. Used to select the properties to be returned in the GET response.

FilterParameter.name: $filter
FilterParameter.description: An OData $filter clause. Used to filter results that are returned in the GET response.

MaxResultsParameter.name: maxresults
MaxResultsParameter.description: The maximum number of items to return in the response. A maximum of 1000 files can be returned.

OutputDirectoryIdParameter.name: outputdirectoryid
OutputDirectoryIdParameter.description: Id of the job output directory. This is the OutputDirectory-->id parameter that is given by the user during Create Job.

DownloadLinkExpiryParameter.name: linkexpiryinminutes
DownloadLinkExpiryParameter.description: The number of minutes after which the download link will expire.
